Regards,

entry.title: Think Twice: Customizations That Break Your Integration
entry.content:
When you build data integrations between applications, small details are very important. If you miss them, you might need to rebuild parts of the integration later, which costs time and money.

One common case is when a team asks the client to make custom changes in their system to help sync the data. This might work in the short term, but it can also bring risks if you donâ€™t think it through.

Before you suggest or require such changes, ask yourself:

  1. Will this work for all clients, or just a few?
  2. Does it require an extra license?
  3. Can the client do it themselves, or will they need outside help (for example, a vendor)?
  4. Is it supported in every version of the app?
  5. Could this setting be removed or changed later in the app?

Why this matters:

  1. Scalability â€“> integrations should work for many clients, not only special cases.
  2. Maintainability â€“> customizations can break after upgrades and create extra work.
  3. Risk reduction â€“> planning early helps avoid broken syncs and unhappy clients.

By asking these questions up front, you can save a lot of rework and keep integrations stable in the long run.

entry.title: Planned Depreciation for Following Month Showing Double the Expected Amount
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

After performing a fixed asset migration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) for asset transfer during the fiscal year, I noticed that the planned ordinary depreciation for the following month (e.g., period 10 â€“ October 2025) is double the expected amount.

The worksheet that I used in the Fixed Asset - Posting template is "Posting Key", "Posted Value", "Transaction Header", "Transaction Item"

Here are the key details of the migrated asset:

  • Capitalization Date: 28-Feb-2025

  • Transfer (Cut-off) Date: 30-Sep-2025

  • Useful Life: 24 months

  • Depreciation Key: Straight line to zero

  • Acquisition Value: 300,000 

  • Accumulated Depreciation (Marâ€“Sep): 87,500 (7 months Ã— 12,500)

  • Expected monthly depreciation: 12,500 (***Which should also apply for following depreciation period)

However, the Planned Depreciation for Period 10 is shown as 25,000 instead of 12,500.

Could you please explain what might cause the system to display double planned depreciation for the first period after migration?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
HY

SAP S/4HANA Finance

entry.title: SAP MDG FI: Node XXX is not located within the hierarchy
entry.content:
Hi SCN Community,

I hope you are all doing well.

While performing operations on SAP MDG Finance Data Loads (Cost and Profit Center Hierarchy), I encountered an error during File Upload â€“ Step 04 (Check & Execute):

"Node XXX is not located within hierarchy."

Interestingly, this cost hierarchy already exists in the system for the given edition, but it is not visible under Display Master Data: Cost Center Group hierarchy.

Hereâ€™s what I have already checked:

  • In Steps 1 to 3 of File Upload, all parameters were evaluated and assigned correctly.
  • The variant settings appear fine.
  • The hierarchy structure in the system matches the Excel file.

Iâ€™m unsure what might be causing this issue. Could anyone please guide me on:

  • What parameters I should re-check or adjust?
  • Possible reasons why the hierarchy is not being recognized at Step 04?
  • Any best practices or troubleshooting steps for this scenario?

Your insights or experiences would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best Regards, 
Sandeep Suggu.

entry.title: Document Splitting â€“ Overflow Error after Changes in Business Transaction Variant 0000/0001
entry.content:
I have a document splitting issue where additional categories were assigned in the business transaction and transaction variant 0000/0001 for the GRN (Goods Receipt Note) process.

After this, the system started throwing "Document Splitting causes field overflow for currency type Quantity - GLT0004". SAP recommends reverting the configuration to the standard settings, but I am not sure about the impacts of doing so or the best approach to perform this adjustment.

Could anyone please assist or share guidance on how to proceed?

entry.title: Seeking Guidance on Configuring Access for Vendor Transactions in S4HANA Public Cloud System
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We have four users with specific roles and restrictions:

User A:
- Can post entries for a specific vendor.
- Needs access to all postings and reports related to that vendor.

User B:
- No access to any data related to the vendor managed by User A.

User C:
- Can make payments for all vendors except the one managed by User A.
- Vendor managed by User A should not be visible in any payment applications.

User ðŸ˜§
- Can make payments only for the vendor managed by User A.

Applications in use include:
- Maintain Business Partner
- Create Supplier Invoice Advance
- Manage Supplier Line Item
- Display Supplier Balance
- Manage Automatic Payment
- Display Journal Entries (with respect to vendor)
- Supplier Down Payment
- Post Outgoing Payment

Could you please suggest ways to configure these settings and meet the requirements?

Could you please help me with a solution for this issue?

 

Thank you.

Finance_ Asset Accounting_ SAP S4HANA PUBLIC CLOUD

entry.title: Advice on Payment Term Configuration in OBB8
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts,

I have question on how to achieve these scenarios from OBB8 configuration:

1. Invoice dated 15 August 2025 with document due on 31.10.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Entitle for % discount (Pass)
2. Invoice dated 15 July 2025 with document due on 30.09.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Not entitle for discount (Failed - SAP still showing discount for this document)
3. Invoice dated 15 October 2025 - Shouldn't appear in F110 payment listing (Pass)
 
I have set configuration Payment term Z061:
Term 1: Percentage (1.5%) / Fixed Date (31) / Additional Months (2) - which is failed at 2nd scenario.
 
From my understanding, this vendor only has 1 term.
Due date must always EOM + 2 Months together with discount. If the document is paid after due, no discount should apply at F110.

entry.title: F150 Mahndruck Sprache Standardtexte
entry.content:
Hallo SAP-Support,

wir suchen nach einer MÃ¶glichkeit die Sprache fÃ¼r die Standardtexts zu beeinflussen und von KNA1 abzuweichen. Eine analoge Logik wie in 2632165 wÃ¤re ideal:

  1. EmpfÃ¤ngersprache (KNA1)
  2. Englisch
  3. Anmeldesprache
  4. Sprache des Textes, wenn dieser nur in einer einzigen Sprache vorhanden ist

Wir nutzen PRINT_DUNNING_NOTICE_SF und wollen in einem Mahnverfahren nur in DE oder EN kommunizieren und die Texte auch nur in diesen beiden Sprachen pflegen.

Vielen Dank!
